title: Y-intercept
text: When graphing $$y=-1+2x$$, the y-intercept would be $$(0,-1)$$ since that represents when $$x=0$$.
speech: When graphing  y is equal to negative 1 plus 2 x , the y-intercept would be , parentheses, 0 comma negative 1,   since that represents when  x is equal to 0 .

title: Slope
text: When graphing $$y=-1+2x$$, the slope would be $$2$$.
speech: When graphing  y is equal to, negative 1 plus 2 x , the slope would be  2 .

title: Line
text: Examine if the line is straight or curvy.
speech: Examine if the line is straight or curvy.

title: Meaning
text: A straight line represents a linear relationship.
